author: NFT-DAO (the whole team)
title: NFT-DAO EZ-On Interop NFTs
description: NFTs do not travel easily between chains, use models or games; stranding their value and reducing their efficacy with poor interoperability.

assessments.note: This is an interesting project. However it seems to be focused on use cases, not improving the developer ecosystem.
assessments.reply: I wasn't really sure how to categorize this because it is really just the assessors opinion stating this focuses on use cases and not the dev ecosystem.  I'm kind of at a loss for words, because it is a research project to determine how we can create interoperable NFTs that work across ecosystems, or blockchains.  It is clearly a developer centric issue as it involves coding to different standards currently and interoperability of those developer standards.  I submit this is clearly a dev ecosystem issue.  Beyond that, if you even think it is simply use cases, then even that becomes a developer eco system issue as developers build tech to solve use cases.  In this use case we are seeking to make NFTs work acros eco systems.  Therefore I argue this opinion should be tossed out.

assessments.note: Adding interoperability for NFTs and/or harmonizing them in between chains will greatly facilitate their use and implementability and make developing in that area more attractive.

The proposal effectively addresses the challenge and appears to be an extremely daunting final project. What I particularly like about this proposal is that the team is taking small steps towards the big picture. Without really understanding the complexity of the overall task I do feel that the proposal allows me to grasp enough to encourage further work.

This proposal clearly addresses the challenge of creating a positive developer ecosystem by promoting research into interoperable NFTs across chains(Space Travel). There is an overwhelming amount of NFT proposals for Fund 5 in Catalyst. I believe the proposer does a good job of distinguishing from the pack by making this a research project. Promoting collaboration among this experienced group of developers and NFT enthusiast will result in some epic brainstorming sessions and ideally a framework to deploy a scalable and elegant solution.

Looking at this from 30000ft it ticks all the right boxes, What might be useful is to expand on any basic research you/other groups have done to date  and which strand you are potentially looking to explore further. Even if this is at a very high level it will help contextualise the interoperability problem for the voters (most of whom will not read beyond the headline)
assessments.reply: Yes, it's always informative to see how CAs 'here' what we say in proposals.  It's about researching Interoperability, how can my NFT on Cardano travel to Cosmos or move from ETH to Cardano, or be used in a game after minted on Cardano.  Thanks for  your feedback.

assessments.note:
There is clarity in the description of the problem and the solution. The proposal is within the scope of the challenge. One of the big problems with NFTs is that the scarcity of it only exists within the blockchain in which it was created, studying ways to move these NFTs through different blockchains in a safe way is important for the NFT ecosystem to develop. The creation of a viable model of portability of these NFTs could provide new options and tools for developers to expand related applications.

The absence of tangible metrics makes it difficult to assess the impact of this challenge.
assessments.reply:
The metrics (or measures) are in the proposal they include a) Research, b) Market Testing and 3) Creating a detailed proposal from our findings.  The development of the detailed proposal is the thing to measure, and of course the research will generate the requirements.                                                                                                            
 Phase 1:  - Research best options for an elegant interoperable NFT solution with MuKn;  - Market testing the concept with other NFT communities.  Phase 2: - Submit a detailed Catalyst Proposal for the work to be done to accomplish EZ-On Interop NFTs; - Mutual Knowledge will handle the development; - NFT-DAO will handle the commercialization (requirements, website, market research, partnerships, operations)

assessments.note: The team has experience, but it is a research project, they do not know it they will deliver anything.

The team is very experienced and has credible background by partially already having worked together with IOHK. While the plan and the budget are a bit open and not that defined, since the challenge is open itself this is okay, considering the fact that the team knows what it is doing and it can be assumed that they deliver something worthwhile with the experience they have.
The team has agreements directly with IOHK and are highly qualified to do this research and propose standards. This gives me confidence that the  funds will not be wasted.

The team appears to have the experience and to set off on this proposal and the budget is weighted accordingly. It seems that this preliminary phase will be mostly research based which may be a sticking point for some of the community. However, I do feel that the end product may indeed be very beneficial to the community.

The proposal does an excellent job of listing 9 individuals involved and their relevant experience. Also, the proposer answers 5 guiding questions with enough clarity to demonstrate they are committed to discovering a viable model through research. It is a positive sign that over 320 people have joined the proposers NFT-DOA Discord group and they are contributing already to this vision. The GitHub repositories are active (https://github.com/NFT-DAO). All of these factors give me confidence that some level of plan will be formulated from the research phase and this would be a good investment of Catalyst funds ($8,200).

The NFT DAO team has several members with experience in the field of NFTs and are already participating members of the Catalyst community. In addition, they were one of the winners in Fund3 and are delivering promising results in their projects.

In general the proposal is well structured, there is an objective rationale about the objective of the proposal.

The budget will be destined to do research for one month, but an estimate of hours or workload for the research has not been defined, which makes it difficult to assess the feasibility of the budget.
assessments.reply: Assuming a $100K yr employee was researching this, $8,200 is under their salary.  However, several researchers will engage and report findings, so there shouldn't be any lack of clarity of how quickly we can utilize the funds.

assessments.note: The proposal is well written and explains the importance of the challenge, shows the background of the proposers and the github repository indicates they already did some research regarding the topic making it credible that they will do good work on providing a solution.
The funds are for research. Fruitful results will be the only audit. We will learn in future funding rounds what the team has learned and how they plan to move forward.

Excellent information provided with extensive bio of team presented. Plan satisfactory but possibly an opportunity missed re: detailing examples of what the project might become. As it stands the team are asking for funds to do research which is fine but would have been improved with greater links to examples even if these were simply a mock up or others work  re: bondly reference.
answered above, delivery is measurable. The next proposal is dependant on results of this initial research.

This is an excellent and necessary idea, but since it is just the research phase it is difficult to gauge what success looks like. I understand, as you stated, that in 6 months you would like additional proposals submitted, and in 12 months to have proposals approved and development started. I would have liked more details though on each of these steps including the first month of research. The NFT space is evolving so rapidly it is challenging to map out an interoperable framework between two chains today. It is an order of magnitude more difficult to predict the landscape a year from now. That is why starting research and utilizing this experienced team will be crucial to make "Space Travel" possible on the Cardano blockchain.

There are details about the team's experience and qualification. There is an objective timeline. There is no budget breakdown,no KPIs. I recommend that the proposal describes at least an estimate of hours to develop the research.
assessments.reply: We undertand some people's desire to understand where every nickel is being spent to insure we aren't wasting community funds.  However, we also assert there is ample information and ROI detailed in this proposal to satisfy that concern we aren't wasting resources.  Maximum worldwide accepted working hours in one month @40 hours a week is 173 hours.  We believe funding researchers for a month is adaquate detail to provide for this kind of proposal.  We believe everyone means well, but opinions vs facts shouldn't guide voters and therefore ask this be removed on the basis of opinion.

solution: Space Travel—standardize NFT's across chains, including whether to wrap and burn, or if we can bring them over somehow without burning them.
experience: **MuKn.io**/Glow brings skills of cybersecurity, cryptography, distributed systems, systems programming, economic modeling & mechanism design.
